TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HealthClientApplication extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Represents a HealthVault client application.
Docs.remarks: Use this class for creating a Windows client application for connecting to HealthVault.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ApplicationConnection As ApplicationConnection

Docs.summary: Gets an that represents the connection to HealthVault.
Docs.remarks: This method could cause a request to the network to retrieve the cryptographic object identifier of the certificate used by the application. For example in case the hosting machine is joined to a domain, resolving or retrieving the cryptographic object identifier could result in an LDAP query.
Docs.exception: The application Id or the certificate, or the healthServiceUrl are incorrect.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ApplicationId As Guid

Docs.summary: Gets the ID of the local client application.
Docs.remarks: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.Health.HealthClientApplication Create (Guid applicationId, Guid masterApplicationId);
.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.Health.HealthClientApplication Create(valuetype System.Guid applicationId, valuetype System.Guid masterApplicationId) cil managed
Public Shared Function Create (applicationId As Guid, masterApplicationId As Guid) As HealthClientApplication
static member Create : Guid * Guid -> Microsoft.Health.HealthClientApplication

Docs.param: Unique identifier of the new local client application.
Unique identifier of an existing HealthVault master application. The client application will be created as a child application using the specified application as a parent.
Docs.summary: Create the application using values stored in the app.config file.
Docs.remarks: This method will lookup the certificate in the user certificate store by applicationId. If the certificate does not exist, then a new certificate will be created.
App.config entries are as follows: ShellUrl - The url of the HealthVault shell HealthServiceUrl - the url of the HealthVault platform
Docs.exception: The configuration file does not contain an entry for either ShellUrl or HealthServiceUrl.
Either the or parameter is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Uri GetApplicationCreationUrl() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the URL of a web page that will direct the user to create the application.
Docs.returns: The URL of the application creation web page.
Docs.remarks: Open this URL in a browser window to allow the user to create the application. By default, the client name will be set to the local machine name.
Docs.exception: The value of or is null, or the value of or is or the required application-specific certificate is not found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Uri GetApplicationCreationUrl(string clientName) cil managed
Public Function GetApplicationCreationUrl (clientName As String) As Uri

Docs.summary: Gets the URL of a web page that will direct the user to create the application.
Docs.returns: The URL of the application creation web page.
Docs.remarks: Open this URL in a browser window to allow the user to create the application.
Docs.exception: The value of or is null, or the value of or is or the required application-specific certificate is not found.
is empty or null.

MemberSignature.Value: public Uri GetApplicationCreationUrl (string clientName, string optionalQueryParameters);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Uri GetApplicationCreationUrl(string clientName, string optionalQueryParameters) cil managed
Public Function GetApplicationCreationUrl (clientName As String, optionalQueryParameters As String) As Uri

Docs.param:
Optional parameters to be added to the creation URL:
ismra - the application can use multiple records for the same user at one time.
extrecordid - record identifier.
forceappauth - force redirect to APPAUTH target once user is authenticated.
onopt# - A sequence of online optional authorization rule names identifying which rules to present. The sequence begins with 1.
offopt# - A sequence of offline optional authorization rule names identifying which rules to present. The sequence begins with 1.
Docs.summary: Gets the URL of a web page that will direct the user to create the application.
Docs.returns: The URL of the application creation web page.
Docs.remarks: Open this URL in a browser window to allow the user to create the application.
Docs.exception: The value of or is null, or the value of or is or the required application-specific certificate is not found.
is empty or null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Health.ApplicationInfo GetApplicationInfo() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an from the HealthVault server that describes the client application.
Docs.returns: An that describes the application, or null if the application does not exist on the server.

remarks.para: This method makes a call to HealthVault to get the ApplicationInfo. If the application exists, then the ApplicationInfo is created and returned.
If application does not exist, the method returns null. To create the application on the server, call .

Docs.exception: The HealthVault service returned an error. This exception does not indicate that the application does not exist on the server: the method returns null in that case and no exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Uri GetUserAuthorizationUrl() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the URL of a web page that will direct the user to authorize the application.
Docs.returns: The URL of the application authorization web page.
Docs.remarks: Open this URL in a browser window to allow the user to authorize the application.
Docs.exception: The value of is null, or the value of is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Uri GetUserAuthorizationUrl(string optionalQueryParameters) cil managed
Public Function GetUserAuthorizationUrl (optionalQueryParameters As String) As Uri

Docs.param:
Optional parameters to be added to the authorization URL:
ismra - the application can use multiple records for the same user at one time.
extrecordid - record identifier.
forceappauth - force redirect to APPAUTH target once user is authenticated.
onopt# - A sequence of online optional authorization rule names identifying which rules to present. The sequence begins with 1.
offopt# - A sequence of offline optional authorization rule names identifying which rules to present. The sequence begins with 1.
Docs.summary: Gets the URL of a web page that will direct the user to authorize the application, including optional APPAUTH parameters.
Docs.returns: The URL of the application authorization web page.
Docs.remarks: Open this URL in a browser window to allow the user to authorize the application.
Docs.exception: The value of is null, or the value of is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void StartApplicationCreationProcess() cil managed

Docs.summary: Start the application creation process with a default application name.
Docs.remarks: Starts the application creation process by opening a URL in the user's default browser. After this call, the application is responsible for waiting until the authorization process is completed before continuing. A typical implementation will create a UI element that allows the user to indicate that application creation is complete. The name of the child application is set to the local machine name.
Docs.exception: The value of or is null, or the value of or is .
There was an error opening the URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void StartApplicationCreationProcess(string clientName) cil managed

Docs.param: The unique client name to use. The client name specifies the instance name of the application.
Docs.summary: Start the application creation process with a specified application name.
Docs.remarks: Starts the application creation process by opening a URL in the user's default browser. After this call, the application is responsible for waiting until the authorization process is completed before continuing. A typical implementation will create a UI element that allows the user to indicate that application creation is complete.
Docs.exception: The value of or is null, or the value of or is .
is empty or null.
There was an error opening the URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void StartUserAuthorizationProcess() cil managed

Docs.summary: Start the authorization process.
Docs.remarks: Starts the authorization process by opening an authorization page in the user's default browser. After this call, the application is responsible for waiting until the authorization process is completed before continuing. A typical implementation will create a UI element that allows the user to indicate that authorization is complete.
Docs.exception: There was an error opening the authorization URL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void StartUserAuthorizationProcess(string optionalQueryParameters) cil managed

Docs.param:
Optional parameters to be added to the authorization URL:
ismra - the application can use multiple records for the same user at one time.
extrecordid - record identifier.
forceappauth - force redirect to APPAUTH target once user is authenticated.
onopt# - A sequence of online optional authorization rule names identifying which rules to present. The sequence begins with 1.
offopt# - A sequence of offline optional authorization rule names identifying which rules to present. The sequence begins with 1.
Docs.summary: Start the authorization process with optional APPAUTH parameters.
Docs.remarks: Starts the authorization process by opening an authorization page in the user's default browser with optional APPAUTH parameters. After this call, the application is responsible for waiting until the authorization process is completed before continuing. A typical implementation will create a UI element that allows the user to indicate that authorization is complete.
Docs.exception: There was an error opening the uri.
